keyword: how many calories are in peanut butter sandwich
title: How Many Calories Are in a Peanut Butter Sandwich?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in peanut butter sandwich, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Peanut Butter Sandwich?
assumptions: 2 slices white bread, 2 tbsp creamy peanut butter, no jelly or added ingredients; standard serving sizes.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, peanut butter brand, portion sizes, and additions like jelly. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard peanut butter sandwich has about 340 kcal, with 13 g protein and 18 g fat.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with product packaging.

tweaks.label: Use whole wheat bread instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories are in a peanut butter sandwich?
faqs.a: Approximately 340 kcal for a standard version with 2 slices white bread and 2 tbsp peanut butter.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a peanut butter sandwich?
faqs.a: About 13 g protein, mostly from the peanut butter.

faqs.q: Does adding jelly change calories in peanut butter sandwich?
faqs.a: Yes, 1 tbsp jelly adds ~50 kcal, making it around 390 kcal total.

faqs.q: Are peanut butter sandwiches high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, ~18 g total fat per sandwich, primarily healthy unsaturated fats from peanuts.

faqs.q: How to lower calories in a peanut butter sandwich?
faqs.a: Use less peanut butter, opt for whole grain bread, or choose low-sugar varieties to reduce by 20-100 kcal.
